title: From just one A to ... how many F's?! Full regular-season grades for all 30 MLB teams
content: Whether your team is headed to October or packing its bags for the offseason, how did 2025 measure up to expectations?

title: Brees, Fitzgerald headline 2026 HOF nominees
content: Drew Brees and Larry Fitzgerald were picked in their first year of eligibility as two of the nominees among modern era players for the 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame class.

title: Brady defends ethics against 'distrust' over roles
content: Tom Brady is pushing back on concerns that there is a conflict of interest between his roles as a Raiders minority owner and Fox Sports broadcaster.

title: Skubal, Tigers collapse, caught by Guardians
content: Ace Tarik Skubal fell apart on the mound in Cleveland on Tuesday night and Detroit lost its seventh straight game, allowing the Guardians to catch the Tigers in the standings and secure the tiebreaker.

title: Sources: Achiuwa agrees to 1-year deal with Heat
content: Free agent center/forward Precious Achiuwa has agreed to a one-year deal with the Miami Heat, sources told ESPN.

title: Sister Jean, 106, retires over health concerns
content: 106-year-old Jean Dolores Schmidt rose to prominence during Loyola Chicago's epic 2018 NCAA tournament Final Four run.

title: Surging Mariners secure one clinch, eye 'big one'
content: A come-from-behind victory over the Rockies on Tuesday night sent the Mariners back into the postseason and put them on the cusp of a long-awaited division title.

title: Mets win thriller, retake control of last wild card
content: Playoff baseball is already here for the Mets, who rallied from a 6-1 deficit to defeat the Cubs 9-7 on Tuesday and leap back into the sixth slot in the NL playoff pecking order.

title: AD: Gundy exit in best interest of OSU long term
content: Hours after Oklahoma State announced the firing of longtime football coach Mike Gundy amid a 1-2 start, athletic director Chad Weiberg emphasized the decision was made with the "best interest of moving the program forward in the long term."

title: The many lives of Lane Kiffin: 'I'm really trying to make it not about me'
content: One of college football's most polarizing figures, the Ole Miss coach opens up about changing his image.

title: Why the NFL can't stop the illegal tactic teams are using to defend the tush push
content: Teams are using disconcerting signals on defense -- mimicking the snap count -- and the way the game is officiated makes it difficult to stop.

title: NFL Week 4 buzz: What we're hearing on Dart, Penix and early trade deadline talk
content: Here's the latest intel on the Giants starting Jaxson Dart, Michael Penix Jr.'s struggles in Atlanta, the looming trade deadline and more for Week 4.

title: Brad Holmes rebuilt the Lions -- now he's eyeing NFL front offices
content: One of six Black GMs in the NFL, Holmes has helped inspire a franchise and a new generation of executives.

title: Which stars vaulted up our list? Who dropped? NBA Rank 2025 enters the top 50
content: NBA Rank 2025 continues! See which top players just missed the top 10, and who made the biggest leaps this season.

title: Debate: Snubs, surprises -- and what's next for the top 10
content: Do LeBron, Steph Curry and KD belong in the top 10? Wemby is where?! Tackling big NBA Rank questions.

title: For A's fans, new city, same anger
content: A year after the move to West Sacramento, franchise still grapples with low attendance and outrage at owner.

title: Top storylines to watch at the 2025 Ryder Cup
content: How will Bethpage Black play? Who is under the most pressure? We're breaking down the top storylines ahead of the 2025 Ryder Cup.

title: From Liverpool to Wrexham, are U.S. owners taking over English football?
content: In 2025, 11 of the 20 Premier League teams are majority owned by U.S. groups, with many more in the lower leagues. What does it all mean, and where is it going?

title: Ovi breaks another Gretzky record? A draft lottery surprise? Bold predictions for every NHL team
content: With opening night approaching on Oct. 7, we take big swings on what will transpire for each team this season.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Course correct or stay the course on Jeanty, 'Bill' and others
content: Your draft-day plans may not have panned out, but new options have emerged ... sometimes on the same NFL team.

title: Rankings for Week 4
content: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR, as well as Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: Her on-field success was unparalleled. Now Alex Morgan aims for the same heights in business
content: World Cup champion Alex Morgan has swapped the locker room for the board room. It's a move the former USWNT star plotted for years.

title: Philadelphia 76ers unveil Iverson-era throwback uniforms
content: The uniform unveiling celebrates the 25th anniversary of the 76ers' Eastern Conference championship-winning team.

title: Trees are back: Timberwolves unveil KG-era throwback uniforms
content: From 1998 to 2008, Minnesota wore this look, making eight straight playoff appearances and a West finals run.

title: Mike Gundy is out at Oklahoma State: Top candidates, transfers, recruits to watch
content: Gundy's long tenure in Stillwater is over. Who replaces the Pokes legend and who are the key players on the roster?

title: CFP Bubble Watch: A look at every Power 4 team
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: 'Everybody's waiting for that moment': Ohtani gets set for his first two-way October
content: Whether he starts Game 1 on the mound or pitches in relief, Shohei Ohtani is primed to make even more history.

title: What's next for New York Liberty after firing Sandy Brondello?
content: Sandy Brondello seemingly had support from her players, but she's out after four seasons, including the 2024 WNBA title.

title: Isak's first Liverpool goal could be the start of something special
content: It may have been another disjointed display from Liverpool on Tuesday, but it was also another win. Add to that Alexander Isak's first goal for the club, and it's no wonder Arne Slot seems pleased.

title: Early men's Bracketology: Houston stays No. 1, Virginia gives ACC hope
content: The new Cavaliers coach is tasked with winning as big as the coach he once beat in a historic upset. Can it be done in Year 1?

title: What Bruce Pearl's retirement means for Auburn, college basketball
content: The Tigers' winningest coach is retiring. Here's what that means with 42 days until the 2025-26 season.

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Fever, Lynx take 1-0 leads in semifinals
content: The 2025 WNBA semifinals are underway, and Phoenix beat Minnesota in OT in an instant classic Tuesday.

title: Betting buzz: Mendoza, Beck, Moore top three Heisman favorites after Mateer injury
content: Following the news of John Mateer's hand injury, Indiana QB Fernando Mendoza is the new Heisman favorite.

title: College football betting: Is it time to buy into Fernando Mendoza and the Hoosiers?
content: As the odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and national championship, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Saudi clubs still insistent on Fernandes
content: Saudi Pro League clubs are reportedly linked to a move for Manchester United midfielder Bruno Fernandes. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Fantasy basketball draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Should you draft Cooper Flagg in the third round?
content: Our experts weigh in on Flagg and what type of fantasy production they expect out of him as a rookie.

title: Sleepers and busts: Who to draft and who to avoid at current value
content: Here are the best fantasy hockey sleeper picks to draft, as well as which players to avoid at current rankings.

title: Trump turns against Putin: US Prez says Ukraine can win with Nato support
content: In a surprising shift, US President Donald Trump now believes Ukraine can reclaim its territory with EU and NATO support, following a meeting with President Zelenskyy. Trump criticized Russia's prolonged war effort and hinted at potential tariffs. Zelenskyy, addressing the UNGA, urged immediate action against Russia, citing the rising costs of long-term defense.

title: CBSE 2026: Tentative schedule for class 10, 12 out; direct link for datesheet
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has released the tentative datesheet for the 2026 Class 10 and 12 board exams. The examinations will commence on February 17, 2026, with Class 10 concluding on March 9 and Class 12 ending on April 9. Most papers will run from 10:30 am to 1:30 pm, while select subjects are scheduled for shorter durations. A supplementary exam for Class 10 begins May 15, 2026.

title: Ladakh violence: 4 dead, 30 injured; Leh admin bans protests - top developments
content: Sonam Wangchuk halted his hunger strike as protests demanding Ladakh's statehood turned violent, with vandalism reported in Leh. Authorities imposed restrictions, including banning gatherings, after agitators torched a BJP office and clashed with police. The protests, driven by the Leh Apex Body youth wing, advocate for statehood and Sixth Schedule status.

title: Bengaluru techie bags US ‘Einstein visa’: What is O-1; who can apply
content: Frustrated by repeated H-1B visa rejections, Tanush Sharanarthi, an AI professional, successfully secured an O-1 visa, often called the "Einstein visa," by showcasing his extraordinary abilities. This visa, unlike the capped and lottery-based H-1B, recognizes sustained achievement and recognition in fields like science and technology. Immigration lawyers note the O-1's growing popularity amidst increasing H-1B uncertainties and potential restrictions.

title: Comedian-in-chief: Trump at UN - why world no longer takes him seriously
content: At the UN General Assembly, Donald Trump's speech, criticizing the UN and international norms, drew reactions of pity rather than concern. His 'America First' approach is isolating the US, prompting allies to question its reliability. Nations are hedging their bets, drawing closer to China and Russia, as Trump's unpredictability undermines US credibility.

title: Asia Cup | 'I can do the villain role for my country': Sanju Samson
content: Sanju Samson draws inspiration from actor Mohanlal, embracing versatility in India's T20I setup. Despite excelling as an opener with three centuries, he's ready to adapt to middle-order responsibilities, similar to Mohanlal's diverse roles. While adjusting, Samson's commitment to the team remains strong, even as his performance in the new role is still evolving.

title: H-1B visa fee hike: Musk, Nadella among tech leaders who once benefited
content: President Trump's decision to drastically increase H-1B visa fees, from $10,000 to $100,000, has triggered widespread concern in the tech industry, prompting companies to recall H-1B professionals.

title: Zelenskyy at UN: Ukraine prez warns of 'most destructive arms race'
content: President Zelenskyy addressed the UNGA, asserting Russia's refusal to negotiate peace is prolonging the Ukraine war, causing immense suffering and displacement. He warned of escalating global arms race, urging immediate action to halt Russia's aggression and prevent a wider catastrophe. Zelenskyy emphasized the need for robust security guarantees for all nations, not just a select few, to ensure global safety.

title: Jimmy Kimmel returns: Why the joke is on America
content: Trump didn’t even have a functioning teleprompter. And yet he was funnier, than Jimmy Fallon, Stephen Colbert, John Oliver, and any other “comedian” that clings to a desk at 11PM and pretends to be America’s “conscience.” He was born with better comic timing than their monologues ever had. Every rally he holds is essentially a comedy special, complete with callbacks, audience interaction, and improv. No writers’ room, no punch-up meetings—just a septuagenarian free-styling nonsense that makes his crowd laugh harder than any Kimmel bit.

title: US H-1B $100K fees: Netflix calls it 'tax'; founder says it will end lotteries
content: Netflix co-founder Reed Hastings supports Donald Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, a move that contrasts with the widespread criticism from Silicon Valley leaders. While Hastings believes the fee will ensure H-1B visas are reserved for high-value jobs, the White House clarified it's a one-time payment for new petitions only, causing confusion and concern among tech companies, especially startups.

title: Donald Trump's immigration curbs shatter Indian students' dream
content: Donald Trump's proposed H-1B visa fee hike, potentially reaching $100,000, has jeopardized the aspirations of numerous Indian students seeking education and careers in the US. This policy shift prompts many to explore alternative destinations like Canada, the UK, and Australia, while countries like Germany and China actively attract international talent, potentially impacting America's global competitiveness.

title: Economy no longer Trump’s strength, here's what he is doing better this term
content: President Trump's political strengths have shifted, with the economy no longer a major advantage, particularly among independents. He now relies on border security and crime, though approval on crime has dipped slightly. While foreign policy remains steady, support regarding the Israeli-Palestinian conflict has decreased across party lines, impacting his overall approval ratings.

title: Asia Cup: No handshake snub! India continue tradition against B'desh
content: Before the Asia Cup Super Fours match, Suryakumar Yadav and Jaker Ali shook hands. This gesture continues a pattern of avoiding handshakes with Pakistani players. Earlier, Suryakumar avoided shaking hands with Salman Agha. Jakier Ali chose to bowl first after winning the toss. Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate praised Bangladesh's Mustafizur Rahman. Mustafizur is close to reaching 150 T20I wickets.

title: Ladakh violence: BJP accuses Cong of inciting mob; gets a reply from Wangchuk
content: The BJP has accused Congress councillor Phuntsog Stanzin Tsepag of inciting violence during recent protests in Ladakh, sparked by demands for statehood and inclusion under the Sixth Schedule. These protests, which saw the BJP office and vehicles set ablaze, led to activist Sonam Wangchuk calling for peace and expressing sorrow over the vandalism.

title: ‘A filmmaker is a fairer god’: Mahesh Bhatt on crafting love stories - Exclusive
content: Mahesh Bhatt's upcoming romantic musical, 'Tu Meri Poori Kahani,' explores the dilemma of choosing between love and fame, drawing from director Suhrita Das's real-life experiences. Bhatt emphasizes the film's realistic portrayal of modern women's challenges and its potential to offer solace in turbulent times. He hopes the film, starring debutants, will resonate with audiences and generate positive word-of-mouth.

title: Ind vs Pak: Did Gambhir send Rinku to calm down Shubman and Abhishek ? - Video
content: The high-voltage India-Pakistan Asia Cup clash witnessed heated exchanges both on and off the field. Indian openers Abhishek Sharma and Shubman Gill were involved in confrontations with Pakistani pacer Haris Rauf, escalating tensions. Rauf further stoked controversy with a provocative gesture towards the crowd, referencing unverified claims of downing Indian jets.

title: Bihar SIR, PM Modi's 'huglomacy', Gaza: CWC resolution adopted at Patna meet
content: The Congress Working Committee convened in Patna, criticizing the Centre's foreign policy, asserting that Prime Minister Modi's 'huglomacy' has backfired, leading to India's diplomatic isolation and failure to protect national interests. The party addressed assembly election strategies and accused the BJP of "vote chori.

title: IND vs PAK: Shaheen backs Rauf's controversial gestures vs Ind - 'Everyone has right'
content: Pakistani cricketers faced criticism for on-field gestures during the Asia Cup match against India. Shaheen Afridi responded to questions about his teammates' conduct, emphasising individual expression. Afridi highlighted the team's focus on winning the Asia Cup. He expressed optimism about a potential final against India. Afridi acknowledged past struggles against major teams.

title: Could Baldoni be behind Swift & Lively’s friendship breakup?
content: A man linked to Justin Baldoni’s legal team was arrested at Travis Kelce’s Kansas home after trying to serve Taylor Swift deposition papers. The incident reportedly humiliated Swift, who now blames Blake Lively for dragging her into the feud. Sources claim the arrest ended their long-standing friendship.

title: 'I feel bad for Pak players': Ex-India pacer's scathing attack
content: Ishant Sharma expressed sympathy for the current Pakistan cricket team, acknowledging the immense pressure they face from fans. He contrasted their situation with the era of Pakistani cricket legends and emphasized India's superior talent pool, infrastructure, and exposure. Sharma highlighted the mental burden on Pakistani players during India-Pakistan matches, noting the constant scrutiny from their supporters.

title: 'Wicked: For Good' Trailer: Actors tease EPIC conclusion to Elphaba and Glinda's story
content: The new trailer for 'Wicked: For Good' teases an emotional conclusion to Elphaba and Glinda's story. Elphaba, now the 'Wicked Witch,' lives in exile while Glinda rises to fame in Emerald City. As tensions escalate and a mob threatens Elphaba, Glinda proposes a powerful alliance, forcing them to confront their shared past and uncertain future together.

title: Tracing Swami Chaitanyananda: Who is director accused of molesting 15 Delhi students
content: Chinmayanad Saraswati, manager of an engineering institute in Delhi, is accused of sexually harassing multiple female students. Authorities estimate around 12 to 15 students may have been harassed. Police investigations revealed abusive language, obscene messages, and unwanted physical contact. Saraswati is absconding, and the Sri Sharada Peetham has severed ties with him.

title: IND vs PAK: One-sided! Irfan recalls 18-yo moment to back 'no rivalry' claim
content: On the anniversary of India's 2007 T20 World Cup victory, Irfan Pathan subtly highlighted India's dominance over Pakistan in the format since that historic win. Yuvraj Singh and Robin Uthappa also shared their fond memories of the tournament. Suryakumar Yadav recently downplayed the India-Pakistan rivalry, citing India's superior T20I record.

title: Phase-III medical expansion: 10k new MBBS, PG seats; healthcare capacity up
content: The Union Cabinet, chaired by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi, approved Phase-III of the Centrally Sponsored Scheme (CSS) to expand medical education and healthcare infrastructure. The initiative will create 5,000 PG seats and 5,023 MBBS seats, introduce new specialties, and strengthen access to quality healthcare, especially in underserved regions, while generating employment and improving the overall medical workforce in India.

title: Super Typhoon Ragasa: At least 17 dead after Taiwan barrier lake bursts
content: Super Typhoon Ragasa triggered the bursting of a barrier lake in Taiwan's Hualien County, resulting in at least 14 fatalities and 18 injuries. Rescue teams are actively searching for approximately 30 missing individuals after the floodwaters washed away a bridge and inundated a nearby town. Over 7,600 people were evacuated across Taiwan due to the typhoon's impact.

title: Charlie Kirk death: Joe Rogan questions official theory; hints cover-up
content: Joe Rogan has cast doubt on the official narrative surrounding the Charlie Kirk shooting, where the conservative activist tragically died. Rogan highlighted unusual details, such as a decoy suspect and the alleged use of a World War I rifle by the shooter, Tyler Robinson. Robinson, now in custody, faces multiple charges, including aggravated murder, with prosecutors seeking the death penalty.

title: IRCTC corruption case: Court to pronounce charge order; Lalu & family directed to appear
content: The Rouse Avenue Court will announce on October 13 whether charges will be framed against Lalu Prasad Yadav, his family, and others in the IRCTC hotel corruption case. Allegations involve irregularities in awarding maintenance contracts for IRCTC hotels during Yadav's tenure as railway minister. The CBI claims Yadav received land in exchange, while his counsel argues the tenders were fairly awarded and seeks discharge.

title: Pilots’ body seeks judicial probe into Air India AI171 crash
content: The Federation of Indian Pilots (FIP) has urged the government to launch a judicial inquiry into the Air India Flight AI 171 crash, citing concerns about bias and leaks within the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau's (AAIB) ongoing probe. FIP alleges the AAIB prematurely blamed the pilots and violated investigation protocols, potentially jeopardizing the integrity of the findings.

title: Salman Khan on wanting kids: Blames himself for failed romances; ‘Nahi jama toh’
content: Salman Khan and Aamir Khan are set to inaugurate Kajol and Twinkle Khanna’s new chat show, ‘Two Much’, premiering on September 25. Salman candidly discusses past relationships, admitting his role in their outcomes and expressing his desire for children. Aamir reflects on strengthening his bond with Salman during his divorce and admits to being judgmental early in their friendship.

title: India-US trade deal: Goyal in America; ‘talks happening at different levels’
content: India and the US are engaged in ongoing trade discussions, with Minister Piyush Goyal currently in the US alongside key officials. These talks follow recent meetings in New Delhi regarding a proposed bilateral trade agreement, aiming for a swift and advantageous conclusion.

title: 'BJP has mentally retired Nitish': Kharge says NDA's internal conflict out in open; targets PM Modi
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge asserted that BJP now views Bihar CM Nitish Kumar as a burden before assembly polls, highlighting internal NDA conflict. He emphasized Bihar's demand for a caste census, noting that 80% of the population belongs to OBC, EBC, and SC/ST communities. BJP criticized the INDIA bloc, suggesting discord over seat-sharing and diminishing Tejashwi Yadav's CM prospects.

title: King Charles to Prince Harry: No ‘half-in, half-out’; decision made after 54-min talk
content: Prince Harry will not resume royal duties. King Charles maintains a strict stance. He insists on full commitment to the monarchy. There is no middle ground for royals with private ventures. This decision follows Harry and Meghan's departure in 2020. Reconciliation efforts continue. However, official roles remain unchanged. Harry focuses on philanthropic work.

title: Air India crash: Pilots’ body writes to MoCA seeking judicial probe
content: The Federation of Indian Pilots (FIP) has requested a judicial probe into the Air India Flight AI 171 crash, alleging a compromised investigation. In a letter to the Civil Aviation Minister, FIP accused the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) of bias and leaking protected cockpit voice recordings, leading to the character assassination of the pilot.

title: H-1B rejected, O-1 approved: Bengaluru techie gets rare ‘Einstein Visa’
content: Tanush Sharanarthi's journey inspires many tech professionals. He secured the O-1 visa after H-1B rejections. The O-1 visa recognizes extraordinary ability. Sharanarthi's achievements and guidance helped him. His educational background also played a key role. Persistence and strategic focus are key. The O-1 visa demonstrates merit outweighs randomness. His story underscores skill, dedication, and understanding opportunities.

title: TN Class 10 row: Ettappa Maharaja's ‘false’ portrayal; Chaitanya Raja protests
content: Chaitanya Raja, the 42nd titular king of Ettayapuram Samasthanam, led a protest in Thoothukudi demanding removal of ‘false’ portrayals of Ettappa Maharaja in Tamil Nadu Class 10 history textbooks. He cited archival records to counter cinematic distortions and urged fact-based history. Supported by locals and political leaders, the protest sparks wider debate on historical accuracy in education.

title: Ladakh: Massive protest in Leh turns violent amid statehood demand; BJP office, police van set ablaze
content: Protests erupted in Leh, Ladakh, with demonstrators clashing with police and setting a police vehicle on fire. The unrest, spurred by the Leh Apex Body's youth wing, supports environmentalist Sonam Wangchuk's hunger strike. Wangchuk is advocating for statehood and Sixth Schedule status for the Union Territory, amidst stalled talks with the Home Ministry.

title: Health risk: Harvard study links deaths to private equity hospital takeovers; cautions India
content: A Harvard Medical School study reveals increased patient death rates in US hospitals acquired by private equity firms due to staffing and salary cuts, particularly in emergency departments and ICUs. Similar studies highlight concerns about quality of care, adverse events, and financial motivations behind these acquisitions, suggesting that healthier hospitals are targeted for cost-cutting measures.

title: 'Shaheen Afridi jaan de dega': Pakistan star on possible IND vs PAK final
content: Shaheen Shah Afridi responded to criticism about his performance in India-Pakistan matches, asserting his commitment to the team. He addressed concerns about aggressive behavior from Pakistani players, clarifying it's not a planned strategy but a natural part of their game.

title: IAF's iconic MiG-21 jets to bow out on September 26
content: After six decades of service, the Indian Air Force is set to retire its iconic MiG-21 fighter jets on September 26. The decommissioning ceremony and flypast will occur at Chandigarh Air Force Station, where the aircraft was first inducted in 1963.

title: Plant my flag list: Greg Wyshynski's 10 must-draft players
content: Greg Wyshynski reveals the 10 players he's queuing up in every one of his fantasy hockey drafts this season.

title: 3 Maoists Killed In Gunfight With Security Forces In Jharkhand
content: At least three members of a banned Maoist splinter group were killed in a gunfight with security forces in Jharkhand's Gumla district on Wednesday morning, police said.

title: On Aadhaar For Voter Roll Change, Sources In Poll Body Clarify Timing
content: The Election Commission of India has made it mandatory to provide an Aadhaar-linked mobile number for any online voter addition, deletion, or modification requests. Applicants must now provide their Aadhaar-linked number to process their applications

title: Pak Teen Gets 100-Year Jail Term For Killing 4 Family Members Over PUBG Game
content: A Pakistani court on Wednesday sentenced a teenager to a 100-year jail term for killing his mother, a brother, and two sisters in a fit of rage over the issue of playing online PUBG games.

title: Rain Dampens Spirit Of Kolkata's Famous Used Books Market In Puja Season
content: The Kolkata downpour has left a trail of damage at Asia's largest secondhand books market in College Street. Thousands of books damaged by rainwater have been dumped into garbage bins on both sides of the street.

title: If Conversion Is Found Illegal, Couple Cannot Be Recognised As Married: Allahabad High Court
content: The Allahabad High Court has held that if conversion is illegal, a marriage based on it will be automatically invalid and the man and woman cannot be recognised as a married couple in the eyes of law.

title: 1 Dead, 2 Injured In Shooting Incident At US Immigration Facility
content: Three people were wounded in a shooting on Wednesday at a federal Immigration and Customs Enforcement office in Dallas, local media reported.

title: Need "Civic Consciousness": Mamata Banerjee After Kolkata Deluge
content: Kolkata flooded after six hours of unprecedented rain, Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee blamed it partly on the garbage dumped on roads, which, she said, interfered with the drainage system and urged the people to have some civic sense.

title: Trump's Escalator Incident At UN Sparks Conspiracy Theories
content: An escalator at the United Nations headquarters in New York abruptly stalled on Tuesday morning just as President Donald Trump and First Lady Melania Trump stepped onto it.

title: Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif To Meet US President Trump In Washington Tomorrow
content: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif will travel from New York to Washington to meet US President Donald Trump on Thursday, as the two sides made a renewed push to reset their bilateral relations.

title: India, US Trade Talks On At Different Levels: Official
content: India-US talks are happening at different levels covering both trade and non-trade issues, an official said.

title: As Ladakh Erupts, Sonam Wangchuk's Appeal For Peace
content: Shortly after a protest to demand statehood for Ladakh turned violent in Leh, activist Sonam Wangchuk called off his fast and said his "message of peaceful path failed"

title: Ashoka University Professor Accused Of Stealing Mohenjodaro Dancing Girl Replica From Delhi Museum
content: A professor of a private university was briefly arrested for allegedly stealing a replica of the iconic Mohenjo-Daro Dancing Girl statue from the National Museum in Delhi.

title: 71 Maoists, Including 30 Carrying Rs 64 Lakh Bounty, Surrender in Chhattisgarh
content: As many as 71 Maoists, 30 of them carrying a collective bounty of Rs 64 lakh, surrendered in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada district on Wednesday, a police official said.

title: Case Against Official After He 'Forced' Her Into Having Physical Relations
content: An FIR has been filed against an administrative officer here after a woman filed a complaint alleging that he forced her into having physical relations with him after proposing marriage, police said on Wednesday.

title: Relationship With Putin 'Meant Nothing': Trump On Failure To End Ukraine War
content: US President Donald Trump on the issue of the Ukraine war, said that he thought it would be the easiest to solve because of his relationship with Russian President Vladimir Putin, however, "that relationship didn't mean anything".

title: UPI Now Accepted In Qatar, Qatar Duty Free Becomes First Merchant
content: NPCI International Payments Ltd, in partnership with Qatar National Bank, has enabled the acceptance of QR code-based Unified Payments Interface across Qatar via point-of-sale terminals for merchants acquired by QNB

title: 4 Killed, Many Injured In Clashes In Ladakh During Statehood Protests: Report
content: Four people were killed and many injured in intense clashes between protesters and security personnel in Leh town of Ladakh on Wednesday, reported news agency Press Trust of India, quoting un-named officials.

title: Video: Road Collapse In Bangkok Creates Massive Sinkhole, Traffic Disrupted
content: A part of a road in Bangkok collapsed on Wednesday, leaving a large sinkhole that disrupted traffic, damaged infrastructure and prompted evacuations in the surrounding area.

title: WHO Confirms 11 New Ebola Cases In Congo
content: Eleven new confirmed cases of Ebola were reported in the Democratic Republic of Congo since the World Health Organisation's last update on September 15, showing a decreasing trend of cases in the recent week, the UN health agency said on Wednesday.

title: Ladakh Festival Cancelled Amid Clashes Between Protesters, Police
content: The four-day annual Ladakh festival was cancelled on the last day on Wednesday after clashes erupted between police and protesters amid a shutdown here.

title: Futures of Giants' Brian Daboll, Joe Schoen hinge on Jaxson Dart's instant success
content: the new york Giants will start rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart in week 4 . the decision came down after coach Brian Daboll left the door open to a change on Monday . he will start until the Giants couldn't justify him being the starter .

title: 🪨 Has Clemson hit rock bottom in the Bottom 10?
content: "Pale September," a tan line from the bottom 10 headquarters, is coming to a close . the days remaining in September have dwindled into single digits, soon to be followed by single-digit temperatures in those pools . for many, September can't wrap up soon enough, he says .

title: MLB playoff pressure rankings: Which World Series contenders must win now -- or else?
content: the answer is a little different for every team, and the force of that pressure changes with each passing season . the more success a team has without winning it all, the more the pressure builds up . only the Dodgers faithful are in a state of pure release -- because it won just last year .

title: October or bust? Inside Juan Soto's roller-coaster first season as a Met
content: the Mets defeated the Cubs 9-7 in their final homestand of the 2025 season . it was the final wild-card playoff spot in the national league . they lost two of three to the San Diego Padres , then lost control of their destiny .

title: Ranking every player in the 2025 Ryder Cup, from Scheffler to McIlroy to Højgaard
content: the 45th Ryder Cup tees off at the black course in farmingdale, new york . the host team has won each of the past five matches . last time a visiting squad captured the Ryder cup was Europe's 1412-1312 victory at Medinah Country Club in 2012 .

title: YAC kings: How Mizzou, FSU, NC State and more are bringing back the run game
content: Florida State began the season with a paradigm-shifting blowout of Alabama . the Seminoles are back in the AP top 10 like 2024 never happened . sign up now Missouri is now 25-5 since the start of 2023 .

title: The inside scoop on Jerry Jones' business ways
content: it has been a common practice for Jones and executive vice president Stephen Jones over the years to engage with their star players in hopes of convincing them to sign a new deal . there is nothing in the collective bargaining agreement that explicitly prevents the discussions . several agents said it is not a good look to circumvent them and go to the player who might not know all the details .

title: 'Multiple injuries': Shooting at ICE detention facility in Dallas; gunman kills self
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: 'Social media must be regulated': Karnataka HC rejects X's plea against Centre
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Tharoor calls tariffs 'sharp setback' after PM’s early outreach to Trump
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Kerala Cabinet approves Bill requiring universities to hold Syndicate meetings every two months; likely to be tabled during the ongoing Assembly session
content: Proposed legislation will also introduce a key provision requiring Vice-Chancellors to convene Syndicate meetings within seven days if formally requested by at least one-third of its members

title: Chef Madhampatty Rangaraj moves Madras High Court to restrain costume designer Joy Crizildaa from defaming him
content: He urges the court to restrain her from making false, malicious and defamatory statements against him in any form of media in order to protect his personality rights

title: Vice President C.P. Radhakrishnan visits Vijayawada Utsav 2025, praises Andhra Pradesh’s progress
content: The Vice President lauds Vijayawada as a ‘hot city with cool people,’ visits Kanaka Durga temple during Dasara celebrations, and highlights the State’s rapid development under Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu

title: WB CM announces compensation for electrocution deaths, urges CESC to follow suit
content: Nine people, which included eight in Kolkata had died of electrocution on Tuesday  and Ms. Banerjee had blamed CESC for the negligence

title: Makeover of three suburban railway stations nearing completion
content: Hafizpet, Huppuguda and HiTech City stations being redeveloped at a cost of ₹81.97 crore; expected to be ready for public use within the next three months

title: Karnataka Health Dept. foils inter-State female foeticide attempt
content: Officials carry out covert operation in Andhra Pradesh; Health Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao commends effort

title: Former IAS officer flags Election Commission of India website’s low cybersecurity score
content: The ECI website got a score of 15/100 on the Mozilla HTTP Observatory, which checks for certain basic cybersecurity hygiene measures; the score improved to 65 hours after ex-IAS Kannan Gopinathan posted on X about the score.

title: Supreme Court slams Maharashtra government for delay in Surendra Gadling trial in 2016 arson case
content: “For how many years will you put a person in custody without trial?” SC asks; directs State to file affidavit with timeline for concluding the trial; Mr. Gadling has been in custody for over six years

title: Civic workers launch indefinite protest seeking timely salary, direct recruitment
content: The day-and-night dharna has been launched in front of the office of the municipal corporation in Dharwad

title: Supreme Court lawyers want ‘corrections’ made to Collegium system
content: They flag the urgent need to usher in a “transparent and equitable framework” for appointment of judges in the top court and High Courts

title: QR code tags help trace missing children, senior citizens at Kanaka Durga temple
content: We have tagged nearly 14,500 children below the age of 10, as well as senior citizens atop Indrakeeladri, says District Collector

title: 'Forcing world to buy American oil': Russia reacts to Trump's 'paper tiger' jibe
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: 'Foul play' in Zubeen Garg's death? Assam CM orders SIT probe; Cong calls for CBI inquiry

title: Ladakh protest: Wangchuk calls off hunger strike after violence, says 'don't want more trouble'
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: TDP MLAs allege misuse of AMRUT 2.0 funds, seek House Committee probe
content: Deputy Speaker Raghu Ramakrishna Raju says the issue need to be discussed and duly inquired, and then a resolution passed in the current Legislative Assembly session itself

title: Five lakh ATLs to be put to use in 10 years: AICTE Member-Secretary
content: 10,000 Atal Tinkering Laboratories have been established across the country so far to instil enthusiasm for science and technology among students at the school level, says Shyama Rath

title: Andhra Pradesh Assembly passes Bill to amend Aquaculture Development Authority Act
content: The proposed amendments seek to reduce the validity of the licence for aquaculture business operations to one year and aquaculture activities to five years

title: NDA govt. in Andhra Pradesh has amassed unprecedented anti-incumbency in one year, says YSRCP chief Jagan
content: The much-publicised Super Six promises, including unemployment stipend and pension for women below 50, have failed to materialise, he says

title: Hostel workers stage protest in Dharwad
content: They are demanding regularisation of services of contract workers in hostels and implementation of revised minimum wages

title: Political leaders recall Bhyrappa’s contribution to Kannada literary world
content: Several political leaders, including Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and former Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda, have condoled the death of veteran Kannada novelist S.L. Bhyrappa

title: Shipwreck: fishermen hold protest meet seeking compensation
content: They say fishing nets of many boats are being destroyed by the debris and the State and Union governments have not taken any steps to remove the wreckage

title: At Swachhotsav, Central University reveals vision to turn campus into a garden
content: To make it happen, awareness about the link between nature and human life is crucial, says Vice-Chancellor Battu Satyanarayana

title: Focus will be on renovation and modernisation of thermal power plants in Andhra Pradesh, says new  MD of AP-Genco Nagalakshmi
content: She also stresses need for AP-Genco to align its operations with the government’s objective of providing 24x7 quality and reliable power through optimum generation

title: Balwant Singh Rajoana’s counsel worries about his sanity, Supreme Court asks who is to blame for delay in execution
content: The case had last come up early in 2025, when the apex court had urged the Union government to take a call on Balwant Singh Rajoana’s mercy petition

title: Congress behind attack on BJP office in Leh, BJP claims
content: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra claims protests led by the Congress Councillor from Upper Leh, and not Gen Z protestors

title: Madras High Court suo motu impleads Chief Secretary, Home Secretary in TVK’s writ petition
content: Justice N. Sathish Kumar directs them to respond by October 16 on framing guidelines to collect security deposits from political parties whenever they hold public meetings & processions

title: Lovely Professional University to host Bharat Innovation Challenge for students
content: The national initiative is designed to empower students aged between 13 and 18 to create impactful, AI-powered solutions to real-world challenges

title: Puthur Zoological Park all set to unveil a new world of wonder
content: CM to inaugurate Kerala’s largest zoological park on October 28; designed by Australian zoo expert John Coe, the project brings a global-class wildlife experience to Thrissur

title: People of Bhyrappa’s native village called him ‘Bhagirathi Swaroopi’
content: He set up the Gowramma Memorial Trust, named after his mother and converted the ancestral home into a library

title: Farmers deplore shortage of urea stocks in Madanapalle
content: Scores of farmers have started rushing to government distribution centres to procure the urea stocks across the district, forming queue lines from early hours

title: State BJP president Madhav invites Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu for Khadi Fair on October 2
content: The BJP leader also urges the Chief Minister to address the long-pending demands of the Vishwakarma community and nomadic tribes

title: S.L. Bhyrappa made Mysuru his home and spoke his mind there
content: S.L. Bhyrappa, who had a complex relationship with fellow-writers espousing views antithetical to his opinions, never hesitated to speak out on issues over which he felt strongly

title: Ensuring quality with quantity in medical education is India’s biggest challenge, says NMC chairman
content: Speaking at 86th foundation day celebrations of IMA Hyderabad City branch, Abhijat Sheth says NMC’s fundamental role is to maintain high-quality medical education through policies, coordination with State medical commissions and expert guidance to the government

title: Anti-corruption cases hit 13-year logjam, FGG urges Chief Minister’s intervention
content: Revanth Reddy urged to streamline procedures and ensure that anti-corruption cases are resolved within two to three years

title: Officials gear up for upcoming Sathya Sai Baba centenary celebrations in Puttaparthi
content: As the event has been declared a State festival, it must reflect the cultural and spiritual ambience of Andhra Pradesh, and should be organised in an eco-friendly manner, says Collector

title: As dust over Sabarimala settles, NSS back in the spotlight
content: The community organisation has consistently maintained political equidistance while positioning itself as a guardian of Hindu tradition. NSS appears to be convinced of LDF stance on Sabarimala and  disenchanted with the positions of UDF and BJP on the hill shrine.

title: Three-day travel literary festival ‘Yaanam’ to be held at Varkala
content: Event to be held from October 17 to 19 and bring together travellers, writers, artists and documentary filmmakers for sharing their experiences

title: Amaravati development works apace, says Municipal Administration Minister Narayana
content: Land Pooling Scheme works, trunk infrastructure and housing projects estimated to cost ₹51,800 crore are in different stages of execution, the Minister informs the Legislative Assembly

title: SP calls for intensive crackdown on ganja menace, child marriages in Chittoor
content: Strict vigil should be maintained on shops located within 100-500 metres of educational institutions, says Tushar Dudi

title: Ladakh Statehood protests: Government defeated peaceful protests by forcing youth to take up violence, says Wangchuk
content: “We had not seen the faces of Gen Z who protested today. Till today, our complaint was that the youth are not participating and only the elderly are part of the protest. Only 25-30 youth participated so far, today it was beyond our imagination”

title: Reservoirs, barrages near full in Andhra Pradesh; first warning issued at Prakasam Barrage in Vijayawada
content: Consistent inflows leave little cushion, forcing officials to resort to regulated releases; the storage levels are expected to support irrigation, power generation, and drinking water supply

title: BMTC warns drivers of strict penalties for mobile phone use while driving
content: The move comes in the wake of a series of accidents involving BMTC buses that have led to loss of lives and tarnished the corporation’s reputation

title: Some schoolteachers abstain from survey duty in Belagavi
content: Teacher representatives say that senior officers of the Social Welfare and the Education departments have given orders to them of deputation without consulting them or obtaining their consent

title: Andhra Pradesh attracts ₹10,644 crore investments in tourism sector in last 15 months, says Minister Kandula Durgesh
content: The government has put in place an investment-driven policy with focus on building circuits, homestays, caravan facilities, and tent cities, the Minister informs the Legislative Council

By

Watch | ‘I am very happy,’ says G.V. Prakash Kumar after winning his second National Award

By
